name: equivocally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not clear and seems to have two opposing meanings, or that is confusing and able to be understood in two different ways: The new biography was received equivocally. Asked how many patients had fully recovered he equivocally stated, "None." See
equivocal
More examplesFewer examplesHe phrased his comments so equivocally we weren’t sure he had made the point at all.Many people surveyed answered equivocally.There are a few possible points, but they are expressed so equivocally that I would only be guessing.
